meanings.definition: Excessive secretion of growth hormone by the pituitary gland, leading to gigantism or acromegaly.
meanings.sent1: Hyperpituitarism can cause a person to grow much taller than usual.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed him with hyperpituitarism after noticing his abnormal growth spurt.
meanings.sent3: The circus had a hyperpituitarism-themed act where the performers seemed to grow taller by the minute.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperpituitarism was like a magic spell, making her tower over everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the evil witch cast a spell of hyperpituitarism on the prince, causing him to grow uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by overactivity of the pituitary gland, resulting in excessive production of one or more hormones.
meanings.sent1: Hyperpituitarism can lead to an imbalance of hormones in the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that hyperpituitarism was causing the hormonal chaos in her system.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about a character with hyperpituitarism who couldn't stop growing, causing funny mishaps.
meanings.sent4: His hyperpituitarism was like a factory in overdrive, churning out hormones at an alarming rate.
meanings.sent5: The image of hyperpituitarism was painted vividly in the movie, showing the effects of hormone overload on the characters.
